name: React Spectrum
description: React Spectrum is a React implementation of Spectrum, Adobe's design system. It provides components that are adaptive to interactions and screen sizes across devices, and includes full screen reader and keyboard navigation support for accessibility.

components.name: Accordion
components.definition: A group of disclosures that can be expanded and collapsed.

components.name: ActionBar
components.definition: Action bars are used for single and bulk selection patterns when a user needs to perform actions on one or more items at the same time.

components.name: ActionButton
components.definition: ActionButtons allow users to perform an action. They're used for similar, task-based options within a workflow, and are ideal for interfaces where buttons aren't meant to draw a lot of attention.

components.name: ActionGroup
components.definition: An ActionGroup is a grouping of ActionButtons that are related to one another.

components.name: ActionMenu
components.definition: ActionMenu combines an ActionButton with a Menu for simple "more actions" use cases.

components.name: AlertDialog
components.definition: AlertDialogs are a specific type of Dialog. They display important information that users need to acknowledge.

components.name: Avatar
components.definition: An avatar is a thumbnail representation of an entity, such as a user or an organization.

components.name: Badge
components.definition: Badges are used for showing a small amount of color-categorized metadata, ideal for getting a user's attention.

components.name: Breadcrumbs
components.definition: Breadcrumbs show hierarchy and navigational context for a user's location within an application.

components.name: Button
components.definition: Buttons allow users to perform an action or to navigate to another page. They have multiple styles for various needs, and are ideal for calling attention to where action is required.

components.name: ButtonGroup
components.definition: ButtonGroup handles overflow for a grouping of buttons whose actions are related to each other.

components.name: Calendar
components.definition: Calendars display a grid of days in one or more months and allow users to select a single date.

components.name: Checkbox
components.definition: Checkboxes allow users to select multiple items from a list of individual items, or to mark one individual item as selected.

components.name: CheckboxGroup
components.definition: A CheckboxGroup allows users to select one or more items from a list of choices.

components.name: ColorArea
components.definition: ColorArea allows users to adjust two channels of an RGB, HSL or HSB color value against a two-dimensional gradient background.

components.name: ColorField
components.definition: A color field allows users to edit a hex color or individual color channel value.

components.name: ColorPicker
components.definition: A ColorPicker combines a swatch with a customizable popover for editing a color.

components.name: ColorSlider
components.definition: ColorSliders allow users to adjust an individual channel of a color value.

components.name: ColorSwatch
components.definition: A ColorSwatch displays a preview of a selected color.

components.name: ColorSwatchPicker
components.definition: A ColorSwatchPicker displays a list of color swatches and allows a user to select one of them.

components.name: ColorWheel
components.definition: ColorWheels allow users to adjust the hue of an HSL or HSB color value on a circular track.

components.name: ComboBox
components.definition: ComboBoxes combine a text entry with a picker menu, allowing users to filter longer lists to only the selections matching a query.

components.name: Content
components.definition: Content represents the primary content within a Spectrum container.

components.name: ContextualHelp
components.definition: Contextual help shows a user extra information about the state of an adjacent component, or a total view.

components.name: DateField
components.definition: DateFields allow users to enter and edit date and time values using a keyboard. Each part of a date value is displayed in an individually editable segment.

components.name: DatePicker
components.definition: DatePickers combine a DateField and a Calendar popover to allow users to enter or select a date and time value.

components.name: DateRangePicker
components.definition: DateRangePickers combine two DateFields and a RangeCalendar popover to allow users to enter or select a date and time range.

components.name: Dialog
components.definition: Dialogs are windows containing contextual information, tasks, or workflows that appear over the user interface. Depending on the kind of Dialog, further interactions may be blocked until the Dialog is acknowledged.

components.name: DialogContainer
components.definition: A DialogContainer accepts a single Dialog as a child, and manages showing and hiding it in a modal. Useful in cases where there is no trigger element or when the trigger unmounts while the dialog is open.

components.name: DialogTrigger
components.definition: DialogTrigger serves as a wrapper around a Dialog and its associated trigger, linking the Dialog's open state with the trigger's press state.

components.name: Disclosure
components.definition: A collapsible section of content composed of a heading that expands and collapses a panel.

components.name: Divider
components.definition: Dividers bring clarity to a layout by grouping and dividing content in close proximity. They can also be used to establish rhythm and hierarchy.

components.name: DropZone
components.definition: A drop zone is an area into which one or multiple objects can be dragged and dropped.

components.name: FileTrigger
components.definition: A FileTrigger allows a user to access the file system with any pressable React Spectrum component.

components.name: Flex
components.definition: A layout container using flexbox. Provides Spectrum dimension values, and supports the gap property to define consistent spacing between items.

components.name: Footer
components.definition: Footer represents a footer within a Spectrum container.

components.name: Form
components.definition: Forms allow users to enter data that can be submitted while providing alignment and styling for form fields.

components.name: Grid
components.definition: A layout container using CSS grid. Supports Spectrum dimensions as values to ensure consistent and adaptive sizing and spacing.

components.name: Header
components.definition: Header represents a header within a Spectrum container.

components.name: Heading
components.definition: Heading is used to create various levels of typographic hierarchies.

components.name: IllustratedMessage
components.definition: An IllustratedMessage displays an illustration and a message, usually for an empty state or an error page.

components.name: Image
components.definition: Image is used to insert and display an image within a component.

components.name: InlineAlert
components.definition: Inline alerts display a non-modal message associated with objects in a view. These are often used in form validation, providing a place to aggregate feedback related to multiple fields.

components.name: Keyboard
components.definition: Keyboard represents text that specifies a keyboard command.

components.name: LabeledValue
components.definition: A LabeledValue displays a non-editable value with a label. It formats numbers, dates, times, and lists according to the user's locale.

components.name: Link
components.definition: Links allow users to navigate to a different location. They can be presented inline inside a paragraph or as standalone text.

components.name: ListBox
components.definition: A list of options that can allow selection of one or more.

components.name: ListView
components.definition: A ListView displays a list of interactive items, and allows a user to navigate, select, or perform an action.

components.name: LogicButton
components.definition: A LogicButton displays an operator within a boolean logic sequence.

components.name: Menu
components.definition: Menus display a list of actions or options that a user can choose.

components.name: MenuTrigger
components.definition: The MenuTrigger serves as a wrapper around a Menu and its associated trigger, linking the Menu's open state with the trigger's press state.

components.name: Meter
components.definition: Meters are visual representations of a quantity or an achievement. Their progress is determined by user actions, rather than system actions.

components.name: NumberField
components.definition: NumberFields allow users to enter a number, and increment or decrement the value using stepper buttons.

components.name: Picker
components.definition: Pickers allow users to choose a single option from a collapsible list of options when space is limited.

components.name: ProgressBar
components.definition: ProgressBars show the progression of a system operation: downloading, uploading, processing, etc., in a visual way. They can represent either determinate or indeterminate progress.

components.name: ProgressCircle
components.definition: ProgressCircles show the progression of a system operation such as downloading, uploading, or processing, in a visual way. They can represent determinate or indeterminate progress.

components.name: Provider
components.definition: Provider is the container for all React Spectrum applications. It defines the theme, locale, and other application level settings.

components.name: RadioGroup
components.definition: Radio buttons allow users to select a single option from a list of mutually exclusive options. All possible options are exposed up front for users to compare.

components.name: RangeCalendar
components.definition: RangeCalendars display a grid of days in one or more months and allow users to select a contiguous range of dates.

components.name: RangeSlider
components.definition: RangeSliders allow users to quickly select a subset range. They should be used when the upper and lower bounds to the range are invariable.

components.name: SearchField
components.definition: A SearchField is a text field designed for searches.

components.name: Slider
components.definition: Sliders allow users to quickly select a value within a range. They should be used when the upper and lower bounds to the range are invariable.

components.name: StatusLight
components.definition: Status lights are used to color code categories and labels commonly found in data visualization. When status lights have a semantic meaning, they should use semantic variant colors.

components.name: Switch
components.definition: Switches allow users to turn an individual option on or off. They are usually used to activate or deactivate a specific setting.

components.name: TableView
components.definition: Tables are containers for displaying information. They allow users to quickly scan, sort, compare, and take action on large amounts of data.

components.name: Tabs
components.definition: Tabs organize content into multiple sections and allow users to navigate between them. The content under the set of tabs should be related and form a coherent unit.

components.name: TagGroup
components.definition: Tags allow users to categorize content. They can represent keywords or people, and are grouped to describe an item or a search request.

components.name: Text
components.definition: Text represents text with no specific semantic meaning.

components.name: TextArea
components.definition: TextAreas are multiline text inputs, useful for cases where users have a sizable amount of text to enter. They allow for all customizations that are available to text fields.

components.name: TextField
components.definition: TextFields are text inputs that allow users to input custom text entries with a keyboard. Various decorations can be displayed around the field to communicate the entry requirements.

components.name: TimeField
components.definition: TimeFields allow users to enter and edit time values using a keyboard. Each part of the time is displayed in an individually editable segment.

components.name: Toast
components.definition: Toasts display brief, temporary notifications. They're meant to be noticed without disrupting a user's experience or requiring an action to be taken.

components.name: ToggleButton
components.definition: ToggleButtons allow users to toggle a selection on or off, for example switching between two states or modes.

components.name: Tooltip
components.definition: Display container for Tooltip content. Has a directional arrow dependent on its placement.

components.name: TreeView
components.definition: A tree view provides users with a way to navigate nested hierarchical information.

components.name: View
components.definition: View is a general purpose container with no specific semantics that can be used for custom styling purposes. It supports Spectrum style props to ensure consistency with other Spectrum components.

components.name: Well
components.definition: A Well is a content container that displays non-editable content separate from other content on the screen. Often this is used to display preformatted text, such as code/markup examples on a documentation page.
